item.title: A bill to facilitate shareholder consideration of proposals to make Settlement Common Stock under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act available to missed enrollees, eligible elders, and eligible persons born after December 18, 1971, and for other purposes.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
For further action, see S.449, which became Public Law 109-179 on 3/13/2006.

summary.text: Amends the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act with respect to procedures for considering amendments to the articles of incorporation of a Native Corporation to authorize the issuance of additional shares of Settlement Common Stock to Alaska Natives born after December 18, 1971 (or their descendants), missed enrollees, and Native Elders. Applies the same voting standards to Corporation shareholder approval of such an amendment as apply to a resolution to establish a Settlement Trust. (Thus requires an affirmative vote of shares representing: (1) a majority of the shares present or represented by proxy at the meeting; or (2) an amount of shares greater than a majority present or represented by proxy at the meeting (but not greater than two-thirds of the Corporation's total voting power), if the Corporation establishes such a level by an amendment to its articles of incorporation.)

bill.title: To facilitate shareholder consideration of making Settlement Common Stock under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act available to Alaska Natives born after December 18, 1971, descendants of Alaska Natives born after December 18, 1971, missed enrollees, and Native Elders, and for other purposes.

item.title: To facilitate shareholder consideration of making Settlement Common Stock under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act available to Alaska Natives born after December 18, 1971, descendants of Alaska Natives born after December 18, 1971, missed enrollees, and Native Elders, and for other purposes.

To facilitate shareholder consideration of making Settlement Common Stock under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act available to Alaska Natives born after December 18, 1971, descendants of Alaska Natives born after December 18, 1971, missed enrollees, and Native Elders, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
